description: Each week, guests and hosts on NPR's Pop Culture Happy Hour share what's bringing them joy. This week: The shows Three Women and Empire, the movie Girls Will Be Girls, and the book Family Style.
title: What's Making Us Happy: A guide to your weekend viewing and reading

description: Each year, NPR TV critic Eric Deggans throws out the Emmys rulebook and chooses his own awards for the best shows on television. Here are this year's Deggys.
title: Ahead of the Emmys on Sunday, NPR’s TV critic presents The Deggy awards

description: Natasha Lyonne, Elizabeth Olsen and Carrie Coon play estranged sisters saying farewell to their terminally ill dad. It's a familiar plot, but writer-director Azazel Jacobs manages to sidesteps cliché.
title: A dying father brings 'His Three Daughters' together, in a sharply written film

description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with actor Ian McKellen about his starring role as a powerful London theater critic who savages "bad performance" in Anand Tucker's new film The Critic.
title: Ian McKellen relishes Machiavellian role in new film 'The Critic'
